contentrichtext.text: '''Shozo Shimamoto''' (22 January 1928 – 25 January 2013) was a [[Japan]]ese artist.<ref>{{cite web|author=http://www.exibart.com |url=http://www.exibart.com/notizia.asp?IDNotizia=39260&IDCategoria=204 |title=Addio Shozo Shimamoto. A ottanticinque anni scompare il grande artista fondatore del Gruppo Gutai |publisher=Exibart.com |date=2012-10-26 |accessdate=2013-01-29}}</ref> He was a co-founder (along with [[Jiro Yoshihara]]) of the avant garde [[Gutai group]] formed in the 1950s, and his works are in museum collections such as those of the [[Tate Gallery]] and the [[Tate Modern]] (in both [[London]] and [[Liverpool]]) and the Hyogo Prefectural Museum of Art in [[Kobe, Japan]]. ''[[New York Times]]'' art critic [[Roberta Smith]] [http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C05E5DD1E3BF936A35757C0A96E958260] has noted him as one of the most daring and independent experimentalists of the postwar international art scene in the 1950s. Internationally today he is especially noted for his work in the "[[mail art]]" genre, of which he was a pioneer. ==References== {{reflist}} *[[Jirō Yoshihara]]; Shōzō Shimamoto; [[Michel Tapié]]; Gutai Bijutsu Kyōkai. [http://www.worldcatlibraries.org/oclc/53194339?tab=details ''Gutai''] [= 具体] (具体美術協会, Nishinomiya-shi : Gutai Bijutsu Kyōkai, 1955-1965) [Japanese : Serial Publication : Periodical] [[OCLC]] 53194339 [Worldcat "Other titles" information: Gutai art exhibition, Aventure informelle, International art of a new era, U.S.A., Japan, Europe, International Sky Festival, Osaka, 1960] ==External links== *[http://www.tate.org.uk/servlet/ArtistWorks?cgroupid=999999961&artistid=4753&page=1 Tate Collection, UK] information on Shimamoto, with images of works in Tate collection *[http://perso.orange.fr/articide.com/gutai/fr/ss.htm French page on Gutaj group] with information on Shimamoto *[http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C05E5DD1E3BF936A35757C0A96E958260 New York Times article] by art critic Roberta Smith: "ART VIEW; When Art Became a Stage and Artists Actors" (April 5, 1998). She names Shimamoto as among the most daring experimentalists on the international art scene: ::"Perhaps driven by the exhilarating mixture of relief, freedom and despair that followed the end of World War II, artists around the world had been experimenting with newly physical, sometimes violent, cathartic ways of making paintings and sculptures. Others were also staging what they called events, or actions or performances that sometimes were as destructive as they were creative.... ::"Some of these artists were doubtlessly influenced by Pollock's example... But the same year brought independent experiments: [[Lucio Fontana]], for example, was in Argentina (or Italy), making images by repeatedly puncturing or slashing painted canvases with knives. And in Japan, '''Shozo Shimamoto''' was symbolically penetrating the sacrosanct picture plane of painting by throwing himself through several layers of rice paper, leaving traces of the event -- the hole surrounded by jagged shards of paper -- as the work of art." *[http://www.shozo.net/prof/indexe.html Shozo Shimamoto]: Official site *[http://www.askart.com/AskART/artists/search/Search_Repeat.aspx?searchtype=IMAGES&artist=11070316 Askart.com] pages on Shimamoto, including color images of the work *[http://www.eugeniodavenezia.eu/en/amici_pittori.php?id=116 A tribute to Shimamoto with photos, an interview written in italian and texts by Tapié and Achille Bonito Oliva] {{Authority control|VIAF=113907741}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Shimamoto, Shozo | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Japanese artist | DATE OF BIRTH = 22 January 1928 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Osaka]] | DATE OF DEATH = 25 January 2013 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shimamoto, Shozo}} [[Category:1928 births]] [[Category:Gutai group member artists]] [[Category:Japanese contemporary artists]] [[Category:2013 deaths]] {{Japan-artist-stub}}
